page.title: 14TRADE
page.content: {Muir of fowlis post office and shop. The shop was built in 1840 and became a post office in 1850.As the owners cottage is attached to the shop opening hours are flexible being 8am to 6.30pm and 10am to 2pm on Sunday. The areas of Tough,Cushnie,Craigievar, Glen-kindie and Muir of Fowlis are served by the shop,which sells everything from groceries to paraffin and animal feed.Customers travel from as far away as Elgin and Inverness to buy home made cheese, peas meal and free range eggs. Mail deliveries are difficult in winter as isolated farms are often snow-bound for days and the whole community may have to rely on the shop for supplies. It is also the local centre for information and gossip,the postmistress knows everyone and plays an essential role in the community.
